alert.note: Alert for Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 10:01AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. For the Blue Mountains - total snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. For the Oregon Cascades - total snow accumulations of 10 to 24 inches for the slopes and valleys, with totals of 2 to 4 feet above 4000 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon and East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday morning. A brief lull is possible Monday evening into early Tuesday, but heavy accumulations will resume after that. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
